byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matthew Rosenberg from Washington, and Jawad Sukhanyar, Mohammad Fahim Abed and Zahra Nader from Kabul.

abstract: Critics accuse former Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai of working behind scenes to destabilize government and exploit moment of national crisis with hopes of returning to power; meets with more than 400 power brokers, officials, clerics and others every month, greater number than he met with while in office.

headline.print_headline: Amid Afghan Chaos, Karzai Keeps Power in Play
headline.main: Afghanistan Is in Chaos. Is That What Hamid Karzai Wants?

snippet: Critics say the former president is working from the wings to destabilize his successor’s government. He says he has no interest in returning to power....
lead_paragraph: Critics say the former president is working from the wings to destabilize his successor’s government. He says he has no interest in returning to power.
